alert.note: Alert for Chesterfield; Dinwiddie; Henrico (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued November 11 at 1:39PM EST until November 11 at 2:00PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 200 PM EST FOR CENTRAL CHESTERFIELD...SOUTH CENTRAL HENRICO AND NORTH CENTRAL DINWIDDIE COUNTIES... At 139 PM EST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Chesterfield Court House, or near Chester, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Chester and Chesterfield Court House around 150 PM EST. Bellwood around 155 PM EST. Bensley around 200 PM EST. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Pocahontas State Park, Beach, Drewrys Bluff, Centralia and Chesterfield. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
